intro: Anthodiscus guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese anthodiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands and riverbanks.
